definition: abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]

sentences.english: Ernest Allen to make the best of their kinds of work chopping.
sentences.chinese: 其物盡其阿倫內斯特種工程斬波。

sentences.english: Larry and Alan are watching the rehearsal.
sentences.chinese: 賴瑞和阿倫正在看彩排。

sentences.english: Ray just broke Reggie's NBA 3-point record this season.
sentences.chinese: 雷阿倫在該賽季剛剛打破了雷吉米勒的三分球記錄。

sentences.english: 'This gives kids the freedom to love both parents, ' Ms. Aronsohn says.
sentences.chinese: “這樣就給了孩子愛父母雙方的自由，”阿倫森說。

sentences.english: That year Allen opened a new arena named the Rose Garden.
sentences.chinese: 那一年阿倫建了個新球館，並命名爲玫瑰花園。

sentences.english: Allen bought the team in 1988 for $70 million.
sentences.chinese: 1988年阿倫花了7000萬美金買下球隊。

sentences.english: "We had to start from scratch," says Allen.
Ray, the Best wishes to you from Hoopers!
sentences.chinese: 雷阿倫收不到我們的禮物，我們只能祝福。

sentences.english: Alencar said he was delighted to welcome Wu in Brazilia.
sentences.chinese: 阿倫卡爾表示非常高興在巴西利亞歡迎吳邦國委員長。

sentences.english: Allan licked the postage stamp and stuck it on the envelope.
sentences.chinese: 阿倫舔了舔郵票，把它貼在信封上。

sentences.english: The Celtics need Allen to find a rhythm from the outside.
sentences.chinese: 凱爾特人需要雷阿倫找到外線進攻的節奏。

sentences.english: Trading Allen also likely will signify the end of the Celtics' current title run.
sentences.chinese: 而交易阿倫也意味着現在的這支凱爾特人走到頭了。

sentences.english: Arlen and colleagues enrolled 42 patients who had castration-resistant prostate cancer.
sentences.chinese: 阿倫和他的同事參加42例誰閹割了抗前列腺癌。

sentences.english: And what about Ray Allen, the all-time 3-point leader?
sentences.chinese: 還有雷阿倫，這位歷史上最好的三分投手？

sentences.english: Both Allen and Rondo have been very inconsistent in the postseason.
sentences.chinese: 雷阿倫和龍多在季後賽的表現都不夠穩定。

sentences.english: Alencar has been since 1997 to fight with abdominal cancer.
sentences.chinese: 阿倫卡爾自1997年以來一直在與腹部腫瘤作鬥爭。

definition: Nelson or Nillson (name)/Horatio Nelson (1758-1805), British naval hero
middle period of a tripartite provincial exam (in former times)/midfield/mid-court (in sports)/half-time/intermission half-way through a performance
Alan, Allen, Allan, Alain etc (name)/A-lan (Chinese female name)
